newsitem.title: LEBANON: Hizbollah guerrillas attack Israeli-backed militia.
newsitem.headline: Hizbollah guerrillas attack Israeli-backed militia.

text.p: Pro-Iranian Hizbollah guerrillas waged a series of attacks against pro-Israeli militia targets in south Lebanon on Monday, pro-Israeli militia sources said.

The guerrillas set off a roadside bomb near a patrol of the South Lebanon Army (SLA) militia near Beit Yahoun crossing point leading into the western sector of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone, SLA sources said.
Other guerrillas fired Sagger rockets at four SLA outposts at Ahmadiyeh, Zaghla, Zemraya and Kawkaba -- all in the eastern sector of the Israeli-held zone, the sources added.
There were no reports of casualties. Israeli and SLA forces retaliated with artillery fire on guerrilla-held hills north of the zone, security sources said.

In Beirut, Hizbollah (Party of God) claimed responsibility for the assaults. The fundamentalist group is waging guerrilla war on Israeli and SLA forces in a bid to oust them from the south Lebanon zone they set up to prevent raids on northern Israel.
